title: 114_hr2391
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015" applies the Medicaid additional rebate requirement to generic drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 applies an additional rebate requirement to generic drugs under Section 1927(c)(3) of the Social Security Act. The rebate amount for non-single source or innovator multiple source drugs is increased. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 increases the rebate amount for non-single source or innovator multiple source drugs under certain provisions, with special rules for application. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 increases rebate amounts for certain drugs, with special rules for application. References to specific dates are adjusted to reflect the lowest average manufacturer price for the drug during a specified period. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts references to specific dates and drug classifications for increased rebate amounts on certain drugs. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts rebate amounts for covered outpatient drugs sold after a certain date by substituting specific dates and drug classifications. The Medicaid Generic Drug Price Fairness Act of 2015 adjusts rebate amounts for covered outpatient drugs sold after December 31, 2014, based on specific drug classifications and applicable quarters.
